summary: This document is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York prisoner roster dated August 5, 2019, listing hundreds of inmates with their names, registration numbers, housing locations, and admission statuses. It includes Jeffrey Epstein, who is listed as being admitted on July 8, 2019, with a status of 'A-PRE' (likely present). The document also contains a prisoner remand order for two individuals. This document is a collection of U.S. Marshals Service prisoner remand forms and rosters dated August 5, 2019, detailing the transfer of numerous federal prisoners to facilities like MCC New York and MDC Brooklyn. It includes booking information and charges for various individuals, some of whom are associated with the Southern District of New York (SDNY). This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons forms and logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York dated August 5, 2019. It includes prisoner remand forms, release authorizations, a running board count sheet, and daily movement logs detailing inmate transfers, releases, and status changes. The records show routine prison administration activities on that date.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein admitted to MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is listed on the prisoner roster as being admitted to the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York.

events.title: Prisoner remand order issued
events.description: A US Marshals Service order remands prisoners Alejandro Flores-Cacho, Nikolas Niftalijev, and Jian Qu to the custody of MCC New York.

events.title: Prisoner Transfer Operations
events.description: Multiple prisoner remand forms and rosters document the transfer of numerous federal prisoners to facilities including MCC New York and MDC Brooklyn.

events.title: MCC New York Prisoner Releases and Transfers
events.description: Multiple inmates were released or transferred from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. Specific releases include Wayne Clarice, Justin Lopez, and Michael Tisdale. A transfer receipt shows 14 prisoners were received from Warden L. N'Diaye for transfer.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is listed as an inmate at MCC New York with an admission date of July 8, 2019, and a status code 'A-PRE'.
The document is a comprehensive inmate roster for MCC New York dated August 5, 2019, containing hundreds of names.
A separate prisoner remand order dated August 6, 2019, directs the delivery of three specific prisoners (Flores-Cacho, Niftalijev, Qu) to MCC New York.
The document provides a snapshot of the prison population at a critical time when Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated there prior to his death.
The roster includes detailed inmate information such as registration numbers, housing unit locations, and admission dates.
The document is a collection of standardized U.S. Marshals Service forms (BP-S377, USM-40) used for remanding federal prisoners to Bureau of Prisons facilities.
All forms are dated August 5, 2019, indicating a coordinated day of prisoner transfers.
The prisoners listed are being transferred to or from facilities associated with the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and Eastern District of New York.
One partially filled form lists a charge under Title 18 USC, Section 2250, which relates to failure to register as a sex offender.
The individuals named appear to be general federal prisoners; none are explicitly identified in this document as being directly connected to the Epstein case.
The documents are routine Bureau of Prisons administrative records from August 5, 2019, showing inmate movements at MCC New York.
No individuals directly related to the Epstein case (e.g., Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, associates, or victims) are named in these specific pages.
The records include release authorizations for inmates Wayne Clarice, Justin Lopez, and Michael Tisdale, and transfer receipts for 14 other inmates.
The forms are standard BOP documents (Prisoner Remand BP-5277.058, Release Authorization BP-A0392, Running Board, Daily Log) used for prison population management.
The context suggests these are likely unrelated to the Epstein case and are instead general prison operations records from the same facility where Epstein was held.
